physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Asymptomatic at the time of evaluation.
Mild to severe left sensorineural hearing loss confirmed by audiogram.
Left intralabyrinthine hemorrhage and a small endolymphatic sac tumor in the left vestibular aqueduct.
Resolution of vertigo and tinnitus following resection of the endolymphatic sac tumor.
New complaints of headaches, frequent hiccups, and swallowing difficulties. MRI revealed development of a peritumoral cyst associated with the obex hemangioblastoma.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Progression of symptoms leading to the surgical intervention.
